revision.comment: Created page with "Possibly: An authentic account of the Embassy of the Dutch East-India Company, to the Court of the Emperor of China, in the years 1794 and 1795; (subsequent to that of the E..."
revision.text: Possibly: An authentic account of the Embassy of the Dutch East-India Company, to the Court of the Emperor of China, in the years 1794 and 1795; (subsequent to that of the Earl of Macartney.) Containing a description of several parts of the Chinese Empire, unknown to Europeans; taken from the journal of Andr√© Everard van Braam, Chief of the Direction of that company, and second in the Embassy. Translated from the original of M. L. E. Moreau de Saint-Mery. With a correct chart of the route. 2v. (London : Printed, for R. Phillips, No. 71, St. Paul's Church-Yard, and sold by J. Debrett, Piccadilly; Lee and Hurst, Paternoster-Row; and by all other booksellers, 1798). http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2439601~S1
